body:
How is the Docker container being started?

Edit: Given this "NOTE: this apparently doesn't happen when I run as the root user. Only as non-root." I guess it might be a permission issue. With which user did you start ZAP the first time?

rename.from: ZAP proxy won't start a second time due to network plugin
rename.to: ZAP proxy won't start a second time due to network add-on

body:
Just a standard `docker run -it zap-bug`
Since I added the line `USER gary` it started as user gary both times.

The run as root was in a different container.

rename.from: ZAP proxy won't start a second time due to network add-on
rename.to: Add-ons being updated might be marked as blocked

body: Any info on a temporary workaround would be appreciated
Disable the add-on updates, or after the first run (which updates the add-ons) remove the file `add-ons-state.xml` located in the ZAP home.

issue.title: Problems to install/uninstall AddOns

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

I have problems to install add-on: open-api -> 

ERROR org.zaproxy.zap.control.AddOnInstaller - An error occurred while installing the add-on: openapi

And to uninstalling the extension "ExtensionNetwork" bundle in the add-on "network" -> 

ERROR org.zaproxy.zap.control.AddOnInstaller - An error occurred while uninstalling the extension "ExtensionNetwork" bundled in the add-on "network":

This problem is in the image docker  owasp/zap2docker-weekly:latest

Thanks for the time and the support.

### Steps to reproduce the behavior

The docker command is:
docker run --rm -e JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS="-Xmx128m" -v $(pwd):/zap/wrk/:rw -t owasp/zap2docker-weekly zap-api-scan.py -i -a -S -T 20 -t target -f openapi -J report.json -r $report.html active-scan -deamon

### Expected behavior

The analysis with the report generation (Note the automatization stopped working at 28/10/2022)

### Software versions

image docker: owasp/zap2docker-weekly latest

docker version 19.03


### Screenshots

Logs of errors

open-api

![01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44484749/198636726-665f18ba-e5ad-4881-bd1d-cddc11c3c441.jpeg)

network

![02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44484749/198637971-fdeb15c8-a5cc-41ab-9832-2a105ca25018.jpeg)

![03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44484749/198638885-f71892e4-8337-4732-9a7d-c19f5ce238e5.jpeg)



### Errors from the zap.log file

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Would you like to help fix this issue?

- [X] Yes

issue.title: Carry add-ons' update state when uninstalling

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Use the flag that indicates if the add-ons are being updated when uninstalling them.

Fix #7590.

body: This issue has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
